page.title: 01 Background to the area.
page.content: This rural area is on the edge of the Cotswolds, near Witney, Oxfordshire, in the valley of the River Windrush. It includes the ancient villages of Cogges and S. Leigh. Until recently Cogges was a village in its own right, separated from the town of Witney by the river and ancient water meadows Witney is now expanding and Cogges is rapidly becoming a part of Witney. There is much new housing development, both of private and council estates, with a variety of styles, materials and sizes although emphasis is on small homes rather than on luxury development The small village of South Leigh still exists separately as a quiet, rural village but also relies on Witney for shops and services. It still has a pub! Farming is mixed but the emphasis is changing from a predominance of dairy farming to more cereals, oilseed rape.
